discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

D
"To properly handle exceptions, wrap the commands with try/except in the main. The return_error() function receives error message and returns error entry back into Cortex XSOAR"
https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/integrations/code-conventions

questions.question_text: The XSOAR administrator is writing an automation and would like to return an error entry back into XSOAR if a particular command errors out. How can this be achieved?

choices.D: A Linux server connected with an XSOAR server using SSH integration. Commands can be run remotely to access the mail server.
choices.A: XSOAR D2 Agents, to send the required emails.
choices.B: An XSOAR engine that is downloaded from the XSOAR server and installed within the subsidiary.
choices.C: Another XSOAR server that uses the same license as their primary XSOAR server.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is B!

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. You need to map the HTML content generated by the playbook task directly to the custom HTML field in the indicator layout. The Mapping option allows you to specify how the output of the playbook task should be mapped to various fields, including custom HTML fields.

!SetIndicator command, is generally used for setting the value of standard indicator fields but may not be the best choice for custom fields, especially those of type "HTML."

comments.content: The !SetIndicator command is generally used for setting values in indicator fields but may not be suitable for handling HTML content directly. So the answer is D.

discussion.content: !setindicator command is needed to pull context data and move it to the indicator.

choices.A: Populate the custom indicator field with the built-in !SetIndicator command.
choices.C: Create a custom Indicator Mapper and populate the custom indicator field.
choices.B: Add HTML to a list using !setList and use it as an HTML template to populate the custom indicator field.
choices.D: Use the Mapping option in the playbook task that generates the HTML report to populate the custom indicator field.

questions.question_text:
A playbook task generates a report as HTML in the context data.

An engineer creates a custom indicator field of type "HTML" and adds the field to a section in a custom indicator layout. How can the engineer populate the HTML field in the indicator layout?

choices.D: Automatically from playbook tasks when the option is selected on the Advanced tab
choices.A: Manually directly from the War Room with the Actions drop-down
choices.C: Manually from the playbook task (mark as entry icon)
choices.B: From the Notes section (mark as entry icon)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
Don't exist !MarkAsEvidence command, only exist !MarkAsEvidenceByTag command. E option is bad.

Selected Answer: ABD
Option C is not typically used for marking entries as evidence directly. 

Option E, !MarkAsEvidence, is used for marking items as evidence but is not a standard method for adding evidence from within the Evidence Board interface.

Selected Answer: ADE
ADE is correct

Selected Answer: ADE
ADE is correct

questions.question_text: What are the three ways to add/mark entries as evidence inside the Evidence Board? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
While option D - reputation, this tag alone does not specify that the script is intended for use with reputation-based indicator types.
So, reputationScript is the appropriate tag for making the script available in the context of configuring indicator types.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

questions.question_text: Which tag must be applied to an Automation Script in order for it to be available when configuring an Indicator Type?
